events.description: The release of Lithuania's trade balance figures for December 2025 and the full-year 2025 summary.

facts.fact_text: Lithuania's trade deficit narrowed to EUR 0.506 billion in December 2025 from EUR 0.632 billion in December 2024.

evidences.evidence_text: Lithuania’s trade deficit narrowed to EUR 0.506 billion in December 2025 from EUR 0.632 billion in December 2024

facts.fact_text: Exports grew 8% year-on-year to EUR 2.856 billion in December 2025.

evidences.evidence_text: Exports surged 8% year-on-year to EUR 2.856 billion

facts.fact_text: Imports rose by 2.6% year-on-year to EUR 3.361 billion in December 2025.

evidences.evidence_text: imports also rose by 2.6% year-on-year to EUR 3.361 billion

facts.fact_text: The full-year 2025 trade deficit widened to EUR 6.525 billion from EUR 4.598 billion in the previous year.

evidences.evidence_text: for full-year 2025, the country’s trade deficit widened to EUR 6.525 billion from EUR 4.598 billion.

facts.fact_text: Exports to Ukraine increased by 16.6% during the period.
Imports from China increased by 20.6% during the period.

claims.claim_text: The narrowing of the trade deficit in December was caused by exports growing at a significantly faster rate than imports.

evidences.evidence_text: Lithuania’s trade deficit narrowed... as exports grew at a much faster pace than imports.

evidence.evidence_text: Exports surged 8% year-on-year to EUR 2.856 billion, supported by strong increases in fertilizers (44.2%)
imports also rose by 2.6% year-on-year to EUR 3.361 billion, driven by higher purchases of electrical machinery
Exports surged 8% year-on-year... supported by strong increases in fertilizers (44.2%)
Lithuania’s trade deficit narrowed to EUR 0.506 billion in December 2025
